```{.r .cell-code}
                layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata <- read_csv("D:/hoshihui/IS415-VAA/Hands-on_Ex/Hands-on_Ex01/data/aspatial/respopagesextod2011to2020.csv")
```

:::


## 2.2.2 Data Preparation


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Data wrangling
popdata2020 <- popdata %>%
  filter(Time == 2020) %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP) %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[12])) %>%
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:11])+
rowSums(.[13:15]))%>%
mutate(`AGED`=rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
mutate(`TOTAL`=rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%  
mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)
/`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`, 
       `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, 
       `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 332 × 7
   PA         SZ                   YOUNG `ECONOMY ACTIVE`  AGED TOTAL DEPENDENCY
   <chr>      <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
 1 Ang Mo Kio Ang Mo Kio Town Cen…  1440             2610   760  4810      0.843
 2 Ang Mo Kio Cheng San             6640            15460  6050 28150      0.821
 3 Ang Mo Kio Chong Boon            6150            13950  6470 26570      0.905
 4 Ang Mo Kio Kebun Bahru           5540            12090  5120 22750      0.882
 5 Ang Mo Kio Sembawang Hills       2100             3410  1310  6820      1    
 6 Ang Mo Kio Shangri-La            3960             8420  3610 15990      0.899
 7 Ang Mo Kio Tagore                2220             4200  1530  7950      0.893
 8 Ang Mo Kio Townsville            4690            11450  5100 21240      0.855
 9 Ang Mo Kio Yio Chu Kang             0                0     0     0    NaN    
10 Ang Mo Kio Yio Chu Kang East     1220             2300   750  4270      0.857
# ℹ 322 more rows
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#group_by: group the three column of daa together and each unique combination will be a separate group
#summarise: create a new column
#ungroup: remove the grouping so new operations applied to entire dataset
#pivot_wider(names_from = AG, values from = POP): reshapes data from long format to wide format. unique values in AG column become new column names and corresponding values from POP column are filled in these new column
#mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])): create new column called young with and sum the values
#select: select particular column for the final output
```
:::


### 2.2.2.1 Joining attribute data and geospatial data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020 <- popdata2020 %>% mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), .funs = list(toupper)) %>% filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` > 0)
popdata2020
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 234 × 7
   PA         SZ                   YOUNG `ECONOMY ACTIVE`  AGED TOTAL DEPENDENCY
```

```{.r .cell-code}
#mutate_at: transformation to specific column
#.vars = vars(): specifies which column you want to modify
#.funs = list(): specifies functions you want to apply to those columns

mpsz_pop2020 <- left_join(mpsz, popdata2020, by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))
mpsz_pop2020
```

```{.r .cell-code}
#left-join: merging two data sets but comparing on mpsz data

write_rds(mpsz_pop2020, "D:/hoshihui/IS415-VAA/Hands-on_Ex/Hands-on_Ex01/data/respopagesextod2011to2020.csv")
#create a new file
```
:::


# 2.3 Choropleth Mapping Geospatial Data using tmap

## 2.3.1 Plotting a choropleth map using qtm


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot") #static map because of plot
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qtm(mpsz_pop2020, fill = "DEPENDENCY") #to map the attribute with the legends
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#cannot customise anymore
```
:::


##2.3.2 Creating choropleth map using tmap's elements


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "Dependency ratio") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio by planning subzone",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar() +
  tm_grid(alpha =0.2) +
  tm_credits("Source: Planning Sub-zone boundary from Urban Redevelopment Authorithy (URA)\n and Population data from Department of Statistics DOS", 
             position = c("left", "bottom"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#tm_compass: specify type of compass
#tm_scale_bar: adds a scale bar to the map
```
:::


### 2.3.2.1 Drawing base map


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) + tm_polygons() #can customise by adding borders legends etc
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) + tm_polygons("DEPENDENCY")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) + tm_fill("DEPENDENCY") #without the borders
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +tm_fill("DEPENDENCY") + tm_borders(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#lwd = line width
#alpha = control transparency level of the border, 0 mean transparent, 1 means opaque
#other arguments for tm_borders is col = border colour, lty: border line type
```
:::


## 2.3.3 Data classification methods of tmap


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Plotting choropleth maps with built in classification
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 5,
          style = "jenks") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 5,
          style = "quantile") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 5,
          style = "equal") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#n represent the number of bins means categories the legend should show
#style: specifies method for dividing the data. quantile means divide so each category has equal data points. equal divide into 5 equal width interval. jenks are based on natural groupings, grouping similar values together
```
:::


*DIY: Using what you had learned, prepare choropleth maps by using different classification methods supported by tmap and compare their differences.*

*DIY: Preparing choropleth maps by using similar classification method but with different numbers of classes (i.e. 2, 6, 10, 20). Compare the output maps, what observation can you draw?*

### 2.3.3.1 Plotting choropleth map with custom break


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(mpsz_pop2020$DEPENDENCY)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.    NA's 
 0.1111  0.7147  0.7866  0.8585  0.8763 19.0000      92 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          breaks = c(0, 0.60, 0.70, 0.80, 0.90, 1.00)) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Values have found that are higher than the highest break
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


##2.3.4 Colour Scheme


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 6,
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#use tm_fill palette to change colour
#to reverse the colour shading add a - e.g., -Blues 
```
:::


## 2.3.5 Map Layouts

### 2.3.5.1 Map legend


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "jenks", 
          palette = "Blues", 
          legend.hist = TRUE, 
          legend.is.portrait = TRUE,
          legend.hist.z = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio by planning subzone \n(Jenks classification)",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#legend.hist.z = 0.1: sets height of histogram in the legend as a proportion of the legend height
```
:::


### 2.3.5.2 Map style


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "-Greens") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tmap_style("cobalt")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap style set to "cobalt"
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
other available styles are: "white", "gray", "natural", "col_blind", "albatross", "beaver", "bw", "classic", "watercolor" 
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 2.3.5.3 Cartographic Furniture


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#drawing other furnitures like compass
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "No. of persons") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio \nby planning subzone",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar(width = 0.15) +
  tm_grid(lwd = 0.1, alpha = 0.2) +
  tm_credits("Source: Planning Sub-zone boundary from Urban Redevelopment Authorithy (URA)\n and Population data from Department of Statistics DOS", 
             position = c("left", "bottom"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## 2.3.6 Drawing Small Multiple Choropleth Maps

### 2.3.6.1 Assigning multiple values to at least one of the aesthetic arguments


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons(c("DEPENDENCY","AGED"),
          style = c("equal", "quantile"), 
          palette = list("Blues","Greens")) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c("right", "bottom"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#using the c in tm_fill
```
:::


### 2.3.6.2 Defining a group-by variable in tm_facets


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues",
          thres.poly = 0) + 
  tm_facets(by="REGION_N", 
            free.coords=TRUE, 
            drop.shapes=TRUE) +
  tm_layout(legend.show = FALSE,
            title.position = c("center"), 
            title.size = 20) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: The argument drop.shapes has been renamed to drop.units, and is
therefore deprecated
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 2.3.6.3 Creating multiple stand-alone maps with tm_arrange()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
youngmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("YOUNG", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

agedmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("AGED", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

tmap_arrange(youngmap, agedmap, asp=1, ncol=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#asp: specifies the aspect ratio of he arranged maps, the ratio of the width to the height of the output plot
```
:::


## 2.3.7 Mapping Spatial Object Meeting a Selection Criterion


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020[mpsz_pop2020$REGION_N=="CENTRAL REGION", ])+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues", 
          legend.hist = TRUE, 
          legend.is.portrait = TRUE,
          legend.hist.z = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(legend.outside = TRUE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 5.0,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in pre_process_gt(x, interactive = interactive, orig_crs =
gm$shape.orig_crs): legend.width controls the width of the legend within a map.
Please use legend.outside.size to control the width of the outside legend
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_chap02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#to specify the data you want to use in mpsz_pop2020
```
:::
